full: Reading not only enhances knowledge but also significantly improves mental health and fosters empathy. Just a few minutes of reading lowers stress (up to 68%), more than walking or listening music.
source: according to a University of Sussex study.

Lemon trees (Citrus limon) belong to the same family as oranges and limes. They grow up to 6 meters tall, love warm climates ðŸŒž, and pack vitamin C, fiber, B6, potassium, and magnesium - great for brain health.
Octopuses have three hearts â¤ï¸. Two pump blood through the gills, while the third pumps it to the body. When they swim, the main heart actually stops - thatâ€™s why they prefer crawling.
A single teaspoon of honey represents the lifeâ€™s work of 12 bees. One bee makes just 1/12th of a teaspoon in her entire life. The average jar (500 g) requires around 2 million flower visits.

The Eiffel Tower, built 1887-1888 and 324-meter-tall (with antennas). Over 100 master designers competed with design and Gustave Eiffel won. It grows up to 15 cm taller in summer since heat makes the iron expand. On hot days, Parisâ€™s famous tower literally stretches toward the sun.

Your brain runs on just 20 watts power, burns 20% of your daily calories, even though itâ€™s only 2% of your body weight. The human brain uses about 300â€“400 calories per day just thinking, dreaming, and keeping you alive. It contains around 86 billion neurons and capable of processing information at incredible speeds, making it the most complex structure in the known universe.
Electric cars outsold gasoline cars in the early 1900s. In the 1920s both existed side-by-side, but gasoline won because it was cheaper and gas stations were everywhere.
Jeans were invented in 1873 for gold miners. Levi Strauss and Jacob Davis created the first blue jeans in San Francisco using tough denim and copper rivets so the pants wouldnâ€™t rip.

Humans are the only mammals that sweat through the forehead. We have millions of sweat glands all over the body and can run for hours without overheating - thatâ€™s why we could outrun almost any animal over long distances.

A fully fueled Falcon 9 rocket weighs about 549 tons at liftoff - but 85% of that mass (roughly 480 tons) is pure propellant. Only 4% is the actual spacecraft you see in space photos; the rest is just explosive gasoline to escape Earthâ€™s hug (gravity).

The Falcon 9 rocket is 70 meters tall (taller than a 22-story building), was developed in just 4.5 years by SpaceX - a private company founded by one guy who used to sell PayPal - and first flew successfully in 2010. By 2025 it has launched over 400 times, landing its booster 350+ times like itâ€™s a reusable airplane. Humanity went from zero reusable rockets to vertical-landing skyscrapers in one lifetime.

First thing to do if there's a war in your country is to understand that you will most likely lose electricity, so put blankets, carpets or clothes over the windows to stay warm and reduce light leakage.

The legendary equation that proves even geniuses start simple: 3 + 11 = 14. This basic addition is the foundation of all arithmetic and the first math fact every kid learns worldwide.
The first cut is the deepest: 17 âˆ’ 5 = 12. Subtraction is additionâ€™s edgy twin and the gateway to negative numbers.
The power move begins: 6 Ã— 7 = 42. Multiplication is repeated addition on steroids â€” the first true scaler of quantity.
The great equalizer: 56 Ã· 8 = 7. Division is multiplicationâ€™s inverse and the birth of fractions and ratios.

The Saturn V moon rocket weighed 2,950 tons on the pad â€” 85 % fuel, 10 % oxidizer, 5 % rocket. That means 2,800 tons of explosives just to throw 140 tons (the size of a small house) to the Moon. Tsiolkovsky was not kidding.
